body_html: @vchigrin I now see that it's a bit unclear, but the first $S_q$ is capitalized and is define earlier while the second $s_q$ is lower case and represents the index of the $q$th component of the output tensor. One small typo is where I give the definition of $S_q$ I wrote "defined as by." Could you remove the "as" in that sentence? Thanks again for this PR!

body: @vchigrin I now see that it's a bit unclear, but the first $S_q$ is capitalized and is define earlier while the second $s_q$ is lower case and represents the index of the $q$th component of the output tensor. One small typo is where I give the definition of $S_q$ I wrote "defined as by." Could you remove the "as" in that sentence? Thanks again for this PR!
